intro: Lisianthius skinneri, commonly known as the Skinner's lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
